_chemical.ChemicalName: Hydrogen fluoride/Hydrofluoric acid (conc 50% or greater) [Hydrofluoric acid]

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The Linde Medford facility, owned and operated by Linde LLC is located at 470 West Antelope Road in White City, Oregon. The management and employees of the Medford facility are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of hazardous chemicals.  If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the local fire department, or other authorities to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to the community and the environment.



Facility Description

The Linde facility located in White City, Oregon is a specialty gas manufacturing, distribution and storage facility. The primary operation is the storage and distribution of Boron Trichloride, Boron Trifluoride, Chlorine, Hydrogen Fluoride and Trichlorosilane. Boron Trichloride is received and stored in 1,200 pound containers. The product is purified and filled into cylinders for shipment to customer sites. Boron Trifluoride is received and stored in 70 pound cylinders. The product is purified and filled into cylinders for shipment to customer sites. Chlorine is received and stored in 1,900 pound containers. The product is purified and filled into cylinders for shipment to customer sites. Hydrogen Fluoride is received and stored in 900 pound containers. The product is purified and filled into cylinders for shipment to customer sites. Trichlorosilane is received and stored in a 40,000 pound ISO container. The product is purified and filled into containers for shipment to customer sites.



Regulated Substances

The total inventory of each of the following chemicals at the White City facility exceeds the threshold quantity established in part 68 of Title 40 of the Code of Federal Regulations:



1.  Boron Trichloride

2.  Boron Triflouride

3.  Chlorine   

4.  Hydrogen Flouride 

3.  Trichlorosilane  



Accidental Release Prevention Policy

At Linde we are driven to ensure no harm comes from our actions to people, the environment or the communities in which we operat

e. The policy is the basis for engineering and construction programs that produce equipment, process systems that minimize the possibility of accidental chemical releases and operational safety programs that ensure safe operation of our facilities. Linde is an active member of the American Chemistry Council and subscribes to the council's program of Responsible Care® Employee Health and Safety Code of Management Practices.

  

Emergency Response Policy

It is the policy of the White City facility to prepare and respond to all emergencies as outlined in the White City Emergency Response Plan. The plan includes the actions and responsibilities for employees and site emergency responders in the event of an emergency to ensure the safety of our employees, contractors, and the community. The plan also includes pre-planning, drills and critiques to ensure the site is prepared to respond to an emergency.



Accidental Release Prevention Program

In accordance with OSHA's Process Safety Management standard and EPA's Risk Management Program rule, the White City facility has developed a comprehensive prevention program designed to prevent accident releases of Boron Trichloride, Boron Trifluoride, Chlorine, Hydrogen Fluoride and Trichlorosilane. This program is built around process safety concepts such as:



 - Technical documentation of Process Safety Information, describing the physical properties of the hazardous substances, the safety systems in place to control the substances and the critical operating parameters of the associated equipment and systems



 - Procedures and programs to develop, maintain and control key program elements such as process operations, equipment mechanical integrity, employee training, management of change, hot work permits, incident investigation and contractor activity



 - Initial and periodic review of new or modified processes through application of comprehensive design safety and management of change programs that include Process Ha

zard Analysis study and pre-startup review



The White City facility has an employee participation program that promotes involvement in the process safety program and helps ensure understanding of facility-specific elements of the safety program. Employees serve on task groups and teams in developing and maintaining risk management program elements. They are frequently consulted concerning the various aspects of the program and ways to continually improve the safety of the process.



The prevention program is audited a minimum of every 3 years by our internal audit team to ensure that the process safety concepts and practices are in place and working effectively.



Chemical Specific Prevention Steps

Atmospheric monitors for Boron Trichloride, Boron Trifluoride, Chlorine, Hydrogen Fluoride and Trichlorosilane are in place to detect leaks as a part of the plant's life safety system. This system is designed to stop the transfer of chemicals in the event of a leak.



Five Year Accident History

The White City facility accident history indicates continuous safe operation of our covered chemical processes over the past five years. There were no covered process releasees that resulted in an EPA RMP recordable accident.



Emergency Response Programs

The White City facility has an emergency response program in place to minimize the effects of accidental release of regulated substances on employees, the public and the environment. The plan outlines what actions employees are to take when there is a chemical release. The plan complies with OSHA standard 29 CFR 1910.38 and was coordinated with local emergency response agencies. All employees and contractors are trained in the plan prior to commencement of work annually. The Emergency Response Plan is tested and critiqued twice a year to ensure effectiveness and changes are made to the plan if deficiencies are found. The site has trained Emergency Responders at the technician level and Linde maintains trained technical le

vel Emergency Responses on 24 hour call throughout the United States.



Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Linde continuously improves the safety of our processes using recommendations developed through the prevention program and by soliciting safety suggestions from our employees.  There are no additional safety recommendations specific to Boron Trichloride, Boron Trifluoride, Chlorine, Hydrogen Fluoride and Trichlorosilane scheduled for implementation at this time.
